alert.note: Alert for Clay (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 11:20PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Clay, Pemiscot and east central Dunklin Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1120 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kennett, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kennett, Caruthersville, Hayti, Steele, Holcomb, Hayti Heights, Cooter, Deering, Holland, Bragg City, Pascola, Nimmons, Lorine, West Kennett, Bell City, Noland, Carryville, White Oak, Homestown and Ipley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
